description:
Asahi Kashiwagi lives the typical life of an average high school student — until the day a TV fortune teller’s predictions come true one after another, culminating in a series of risqué encounters! Destiny seemingly draws five beautiful girls into Asahi’s path, and soon he finds himself fielding not one, not two, but five love confessions. Asahi will need to follow his heart to find the perfect love for him, or else his love fortunes may end in one epic flail and flop.

(Source: HIDIVE)

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

name.native: イリヤ・イリューヒン
アメリア・アーヴィング

alternative: Sagami Okamoto Deluxe (相模・岡本・デラックス)

node.description:
__Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Blog](https://hh22.hatenablog.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dne_bu_hh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ひらさわひさよし)

Hisayoshi is a sound director and animation producer, and also the chairman of the animation studios [Creators in Pack](https://anilist.co/studio/6072) and [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/Passione).

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__

__Introduction:__
Q-MHz is a Japanese music production team, consisting of various people from different bands.

__Members:__
- [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi), from the band [UNISON SQURE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden)
- [Tomokazu Tashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/148496)
- [Aki Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/106018), from the band Tsukihiko
- [Katsuhiko Kurosu](https://anilist.co/staff/149133), from the music production company [Peak A Soul+](https://www.peakasoul.net/)

[Website](http://konomi-suzuki.net/) | [Old Blog](http://ameblo.jp/galapa-konomi) | [New Blog](http://ameblo.jp/konomi-suzuki/)

Konomi Suzuki is a Japanese singer from Osaka Prefecture who is signed to Amuleto. After winning the Animax All-Japan Anisong Grand Prix in 2011, she made her debut in 2012 with the release of her first single "Choir Jail", which peaked at 34 on the Oricon charts; the title track of which was used as the opening theme to the anime television series Dusk Maiden of Amnesia. She released her first album 17, in 2014, two albums in 2015, and a further album Lead, in 2016.

Suzuki cites the character Sheryl Nome from Macross Frontier as her inspiration for making music for anime. Her music has been featured in anime series such as The Pet Girl of Sakurasou, No Matter How I Look at It, It's You Guys' Fault I'm Not Popular!, No Game No Life, and Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World. She has also performed in events in Japan such as Animelo Summer Live and Animax Musix, and at international events in China, Germany, the United States, and Southeast Asia. In 2018, Suzuki made her voice acting debut, playing the role of Rin in the anime television series Lost Song.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukikishida) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuki_kishida) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7MhWrfW2HH8_umBaVNbUGw)__

__Yuuki Kishida__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, pianist and keyboardist affiliated with Kick Up Studio.

__Founded:__ 2015

__[Artist Profile (TOY'S FACTORY)](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/q_mhz)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/QMHz_info)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUKcdgw725jOdQ6LfQNYZsA)__

__Introduction:__
Q-MHz is a Japanese music production team, consisting of various people from different bands.

__Members:__
- [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi), from the band [UNISON SQURE GARDEN](https://anilist.co/staff/119406/Unison-Square-Garden)
- [Tomokazu Tashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/148496)
- [Aki Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/106018), from the band Tsukihiko
- [Katsuhiko Kurosu](https://anilist.co/staff/149133), from the music production company [Peak A Soul+](https://www.peakasoul.net/)

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
Producer and VP of business and legal affairs with formerly ADV and now Sentai Filmworks.

Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
